result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric L. SCHMIDT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid as a condition of probation in case no: 14 CF 4.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric L. SCHMIDT

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State files an Amended Information which amends the charge to misdemeanor bail jumping, contrary to Section 946.49(1)(a) of the Wisconsin Statutes. 
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, obstruct officer.  Motion granted.
The Court imposes court costs of $443.00, which are to be paid as a condition of probation in case no: 14 CF 4.
Amended Information.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Minutes.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Plea date is set for 05-06-14 at 8:30 a.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.
Brian Van Ells, through public defender.
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Status conference set for 04-08-14 at 9:00 a.m.   Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 04-08-14 at 9:00 a.m.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts bail jumping and obstruct officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-24-14 at 2:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $150.00 recognizance bond.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
